title: WTB/T T210 Doyle, Dallas Series 3; Note of Thanks w/Final Bump
author: benge610

posts.post_title: WTB/T T210 Doyle, Dallas Series 3; Note of Thanks w/Final Bump
posts.post_content:
There just aren't enough of them out there to accomplish his goal; that's OK because he has gained much experience and is now "researching to the gills", the fella on his first old card.

Thanks go out to;
Karthik (seablaster) and Mac (obcmac).

He's got the bug, maybe that's all that matters.
End of bump and thanks.

Long story. My son has joined me in passion for old cardboard. A lot of fun is now attached to this common Texas Leaguer. It is his first card; he wants to give one to each kid at our family reunion each year; to keep the joy of card collecting, going in the next generations. Sure, it is a silly thing but he wants to do it.  There aren't many out there but it is going to be fun hunting them down; raw or any grade.

Doyle, Dallas
T210 Series 3.

bengehler5gmail.com
also is my Paypal acct

I am a type card collector, especially E cards; so please include your wants/interests; I tend to bottom feed, 2's and down/raw. Eye appeal has always driven my collecting tastes, so not many hammered ones here.
Bump. Is he really that hard to find?
Don’t give up.  I’ve been looking for a specific card for six years, it is coming up soon, I just saw it.  Keep trying.

[quote name="edjs" post=2128312]Don’t give up.  I’ve been looking for a specific card for six years, it is coming up soon, I just saw it.  Keep trying.[/QUOTE]

Thank you Ed. You and I have the same feathers. I continue the hunt. I love how my son has now taken a deep dive into the subject (Doyle) and is exhibiting the passion for history digging; looking for backstory, etc. 
.... just like his old man!
